channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Dozens of countries back International Criminal Court after Trump sanctions
item.description: The International Criminal Court says Trump's executive order seeks to harm its "impartial judicial work".

item.title: Alaska authorities search for missing small plane
item.description: The aircraft carrying 10 people was on flight from Unalakleet to Nome when "its position was lost".

item.title: US border czar blames leaks for hindering immigration raids in Colorado suburb spotlighted by Trump
U.S. Prosecco importers panic as Trump's tariff threat bubbles up
item.description: President Trump's threats to impose new tariffs on European goods has led Americans to suddenly stockpile their favorite Italian wines, especially spa...

item.title: Flu levels now highest since 2009 pandemic, CDC reports
item.description: The CDC says respiratory illness is now "very high" nationwide.

item.title: Sweden plans tighter gun laws after deadly school shooting
item.description: Police confirm seven women and three men - aged between 28 and 68 - were killed in the country's worst mass shooting.

item.title: A search is underway along Alaska's coast for a plane carrying 10 people
item.description: The disappearance marks the third major incident in U.S. aviation in eight days. The Bering Air Caravan, a single-engine turboprop, was heading from U...

item.title: Why is the Trump administration targeting USAID?
item.description: From Day 1, the Trump team has issued a series of orders and statements aimed at the U.S. Agency for International Development.

item.title: Flu cases rise again, while COVID takes a back seat
item.description: It's an unusual winter for respiratory illnesses. The flu is peaking twice: once in early January and again in February. Meanwhile, it's the mildest C...

item.title: The 2025 Super Bowl guide: When is it, who's performing at halftime and how to watch
item.description: From the football field to the halftime stage, here's what to know about the storylines and stakes before Super Bowl 59 kicks off on Sunday.

item.title: Venezuela calls US seizure of plane 'brazen theft'
item.description: The US says the Venezuelan aircraft was involved in violations of US export control and sanctions laws.

item.title: Clean energy industry tailors message to focus on money and jobs
item.description: Clean energy believes industry's profit potential will sell far better in current climate of nationalism and tycoon leadership.

item.title: Trump administration sues Chicago in latest crackdown on ‘sanctuary’ cities
Trump to hold press conference with Japanese prime minister
item.description: President Trump is expected to discuss the economy and defense partnerships with Japan's prime minister.

item.title: "Wicked" star Cynthia Erivo reveals details about upcoming solo album
item.description: In this web exclusive, the Oscar-nominated actress discusses her unique recording style with correspondent Seth Doane. Don't miss our profile of Cynth...

item.title: Trump considering sale of U.S. Steel to Nippon Steel
item.description: President Trump is considering allowing the sale of U.S. Steel to Nippon Steel.

item.title: Judge in Boston to consider latest bid to block Trump’s birthright citizenship order
item.description: A federal judge in Boston will consider a request from 18 states to block President Donald Trump’s executive order ending birthright citizenship for t...

item.title: Japan's PM to seek 'personal relationship' with Trump
item.description: Shared concerns about North Korea are likely to be a primary topic, along with economic ties.
